fields.name: Melanzane
fields.description: You know that purple vegetable emoji that everyone uses to make rude jokes on the internet? It's called an aubergine (or an eggplant if you're an American). The italian word for this vegetable is "melanzana", with "melanzane" being the plural form. Our supplier brings us crates full of juicy melanzane every couple of days. We slice them up and put the juicy slices on our pizzas.
fields.ingredients: Aubergine, cherry tomatoes, dry basil, oregano

fields.name: Diavola
fields.description: The word "diavola", as you probably guessed, translates to "devil". However, this does not, as far as we can tell, refer to THE devil, so don't expect this pizza to be bowels-of-hell hot. On the other hand, spice novices should expect to feel as though hell is in THEIR bowels should they digest just a single bite of it.

fields.name: Valtellina
fields.description: Did you know: Valtellina is a valley in Lombardy. The vegan beef on this pizza of the same name is supposed to be like bresaola, which is this mingin' meat stuff that Valtellina is known for. Valtellina pizzas typically have bresaola on them, hence the name.
fields.ingredients: Vegan beef, arugala, pine nuts, cherry tomatoes, mushrooms

fields.name: Pugliese
fields.description: The name "pugliese" is derived from the name of the region in Italy known as Apulia (Puglia in Italian). Very beautiful place. And you know how Italy looks like a high heel boot? Well, Apulia is actually the heel, so if you're into that sort of thing, this is the pizza for you.
fields.ingredients: Red pepper, red onion, olives, vegan parmesan

fields.name: Boscaiola
fields.description: "Boscaiola" comes from the Italian word for a woodsman. I guess woodsmen collect mushrooms in forests and then smoke meat on wood-fires or something? Sounds like a snooze-fest, just like this pizza was until we dropped some artichoke and parsley on top of it. Only WE can prevent mediocre pizza.

fields.name: Capricciosa
fields.description: Capricciosa means "capricious", a word which is sort of synonymous with "unpredictable". Think weather changing suddenly and unexpectedly several times in one day. How can a pizza behave in this way, you ask? Our waiters regularly do a sweep of all the tables for capricciosas whose toppings need to be swapped out with other ones. Enjoy... while you can.

fields.name: Quattro Formaggi
fields.description: Not uno formaggi, not due formaggi, not even tre formaggi, but QUATTRO formaggi. That's ALL the formaggis. Truly our smelliest pizza (in a good way, of course).
fields.ingredients: Four varieties of vegan cheese, watercress

fields.name: Vegetariana
fields.description: This pizza's name needs no explanation. It's the word "vegetarian" with the letter a on the end, just like pizza is the word pizz with the letter a on the end. This particular vegetarian pizz can also be enjoyed by vegans.

fields.name: Bruschetta
fields.description:
The word "Bruschetta" is derived from the Roman word "bruscare", which means to toast, or to roast over coals. Incidentally, "bruscar" also happens to be the Irish word for rubbish, as in waste or refuse. 

One of our chefs thinks these descriptions are hurting our sales, but he doesn't know what he's talking about.
fields.ingredients: Ciabatta bread, garlic, tomato, vegan buffalo mozzarella, fresh basil, black pepper, olive oil

fields.name: Calzone
fields.description: The word "Calzone" translates to stocking, and is the namesake of this side dish, which is a kind of folded pizza slice filled with cheese and sauce. I've just had an amazing idea for a prank I could pull on Christmas this year...
fields.ingredients: Vegan ricotta, tomato sauce, vegan pepperoni

fields.name: Caprese salad
fields.description: This salad is named after the island of Capri, and is possibly supposed to look like the Italian flag. We also read something about it being served to visiting royalty and statesmen. However, we are happy to announce that we have seized the Caprese and returned it to the dinner tables of the common man.
fields.ingredients: Vegan buffalo mozzarella, beef tomatoes, cherry tomatoes, fresh basil, black pepper, olive oil

fields.name: Garlic pizza bread
fields.description: Yes, you read that right. The two best things have indeed been combined. Has science gone too far?

fields.name: Garlic pizza dough balls
fields.description: Okay, we made another garlic bread thing. This one is a bit like the garlic pizza bread, but the pizza dough is rolled up into balls. We know, we're not selling it very well, but where could we possibly go after garlic pizza bread? Our best work is already behind us, and by us we mean humanity.

fields.name: Margherita al taglio
fields.description: "al taglio" means "by the cut" - "cut" in this case meaning a cut or slice of something. In other words, this is a slice of cheese pizza, but when your menu includes something called the "Diavola", a name like "slice of cheese pizza" doesn't really cut it - *ahem* doesn't really taglio it. Fun fact: Not one of the people working in this restaurant is able to speak Italian.
fields.ingredients: Vegan cheese, tomato sauce, oregano, dry basil
